text.p:
MacLaren ’ s Gaelic Publications
4 / -

Riddles and Enigmas
English and Gaelic
by
Alexander Nicolson , M . A .
Lecturer in Gaelic
at Jordanhill College & University , Glasgow .

GLASGOW
ALEXANDER MACLAREN & SONS ,
GAELIC PUBLISHERS AND BOOKSELLERS
268 ARGYLE STREET ,
[Blank]

Gaelic Riddles and Enigmas
[Toimhseachain agus Dubh - Fhacail]

ALEX . MACLAREN & SONS
Publishers & Booksellers
268 Argyle Street
GLASGOW , C . 2 .
[Blank]

At the ceilidhs , where we were so often regaled by the tales of other days , told with classic grace and dramatic touch , we heard scores of these runes . We treasured them , even more than we did the legends , for the spirit of rivalry was strong ; and whenever two or three of us were gathered together we practised them on one another to find who , for the time being , was to be— “ Fear cobhair nan geas , ” the Solver of Riddles , as well as the Destroyer of Spells .
On those memorable autumn days—ay , and nights too—when , free from school , we herded the weaned lambs , it was our practice to sit on some commanding

rock or knoll , and propound riddles when physical exhaustion followed strenuous trials in leaping and wrestling , and the heading off of lambs that would persist in leaving the main flock : and what a delightful surprise was one day sprung on us when we happened to discover that those mental exercises , that were of such fascination to us , were of the self - same nature as those that engaged the attention of the shepherds in Vergil ’ s “ Eclogues . ” We were , of course , familiar with the riddle set by Samson to the guests at his wedding feast , and we appreciated the importance given to it ; for , were they not allowed a week in which to solve it ? We were afterwards to learn that when the Queen of Sheba came “ to prove Solomon with hard questions , and there was not anything hid from the king which he told her not , ” the tests she posed were riddles— “ venit tentare eum aenigmatibus . ”

Indeed certain of the early Greek poets held riddles in such esteem that they devoted whole poems to them ; but as always happens in a more advanced stage of society , interest in these exercises began to wane , and they came to be looked upon as trifles fit only for the nursery . Many a time had our own efforts at collecting been dismissed as—Obair na cloinne bige ( the work of children ) , and—Faoineas ( vanity ) , the “ verba inepta , ” by which terms they were so often defamed by the early churchmen .

Yet , though many of these may have been composed for the entertainment of children , it is obvious that few , if any at all , were framed by the juvenile mind . They bespeak rather the mature intelligence and the wide experience of adults who had probed deeply into the nature of things . The riddles of veiled import , and those others that are set as elocutionary tests , reveal a remarkable amount of ingenuity in the grouping of terms allied in meaning and in sound . There is fine humour in— “ How is an echo like a woman ? —It will have the last word in spite of you ” ; and the presentation of such a notion as— “ It was born without a soul , it died without a soul , yet a soul was in it—the whale that swallowed Jonah , ” is a flash of wit of such brilliance as rarely glints from the mind of man ; and what subtlety there is in that poser about the shoeing of a horse ! — “ Shoe it with the shoes that are on it , but do not put on it the shoes that are on it . ”

Again the reader will observe that the clues to many are set in terms artistically expressed . The fourth one in this collection is worthy even of a Tennyson , reminding us powerfully of the beautiful address to the dawn—

the unsavoury innuendo . There is none that the most finical could condemn on the score of good taste ; and in this , besides , they are unique—and it is a point that should be stressed—there is none that could be rated , in any way whatsoever , as derogatory to the dignity of womanhood . Many , indeed , are moral maxims , as this— “ What is better than jewels ? —Truth ” ; and , “ What is best for a hero ? —Lofty deed and low conceit . ” One could multiply instances of similar principles that are the definite marks of a race at once pure - minded and of high chivalry .

Tha toimhseachan agam ort ,
Chan e do cheann , chan e do chas ,
Chan e d ’ eideadh , chan e d ’ fhalt ,
Chan e ball a tha ad chorp ,
Ach tha e ort , ’ s cha thomhais thu e .
—D ’ AINM .

Craobh mhor agus ceithir meoir oirre ,
Tri nid dheug anns a h - uile meur ,
Seachd uighean anns a h - uile nead ,
Agus ceithir buill fhichead air a h - uile ugh .
—BLIADHNA , RAITHEAN , SEACHDUINEAN , LAITHEAN AGUS UAIREAN .
No—

Chaidh ceithir a null
Gun choit gun long : —
Fear fada fionn ,
Fear leadagach donn ,
Fear bhualadh nan stuc ,
Fear rusgadh nan crann :
’ Us co nis a tha ann , co nis a tha ann ?

Chi mi thall air faireagan ,
Air ailt na h - eilde ruaidhe ,
Am mac a ’ tighinn ’ o ’ n mhathair ,
’ S a ’ mhathair ’ teicheadh bhuaidhe .
—A ’ CHAMHANAICH .
[Beurla]

Co am beul a ’ s solasaiche a tha air an t - saoghal ?
—BEUL AN LATHA .

Co am beul a ’ s eagalaiche ?
—BEUL NA H - OIDHCHE

Crioganta , craganta , cruaidh ,
Is tana lom a ghruag ,
Is cruaidh craicionn a dha laimhe ,
A shuilean am meadhon a chleibh ,
Agus ’ fheoil am meadhon a chnamh .
—CRUBAG .

Molt dubh anns a ’ choill ,
Gun alt ’ n a dhruim ,
Gun sugh , gun saill ,
Gun cheann cnamha .
—SEILCHEAG .

Tha aon chas air tal ,
A dha air circ ,
Tri air furm - smeuraidh ,
’ Us ceithir air each :
Ach cunntais sin uile ,
’ Us tha a dheich uiread
Air a ’ chruinneig fhainn ,
’ Us co nis a th ’ ann ,
’ Us co nis a th ’ ann ?
—FIOLAN NAN CEUD CHAS .
[Beurla]

Tha slatag an coille Alasdair ,
Cha ghiuthas i , cha dharach i ,
Chan aon fhiodh air thalamh i ,
’ S cha thomhais thu gu oidhch ’ i .
—NATHAIR .

Thugadh biadh gu triuir
Gu cul beinn a ’ cheo ,
Dh ’ ith am biadh an triuir ,
’ Us thill e dachaigh beo .
—CAT A THUGADH LE IOLAIR - FHIRIONN GU A NEAD AGUS A DH ’ ITH AN IOLAIR - BHOIRIONN AGUS NA H - EOIN .
No—
No—

Fear beag fo bhonn creige ,
Ge beag e bi ’ srann aig ’ ;
Currachd air , da adhairc air ,
( Currachd uime , da ghob aige )
’ Us cota buidhe Frangach .
—SEILLEAN .
[Beurla]
No—
No—
No—

Bean bheag a ’ tighinn do ’ n bhaile seo ,
Is creagada creag air a muin ;
Casan oirre , ’ us i gun lamhan ,
’ Us ultachan catha ’ n a h - uchd .
—CEARC .
[Beurla]

Fear beag sporsail
A ’ falbh na mointich ,
Le spuir , agus botunnan ,
’ Us beul adhairce air .
—FEADAG , NO COILEACH - FRAOICH .

Tha ceithir casan air ’ s a ’ mhaduinn ,
Gidheadh tha astar luath air chall .
Le a dha mu mheadhon la ,
Ni e a chuis gu mor na ’ s fearr .
Ged gheibh e ’ m beul na h - oidhche tri ,
Cha shuibhail e ach gu min , mall .
—DUINE .
No—

* When Oedipus repaired to Thebes , in order to escape that fate the oracle had pronounced on him at birth , he found the inhabitants driven to despair by the action of a sphinx that slew all who attempted to enter , or to leave , the city unless they could answer a riddle . In their desperation the Thebans offered the kingdom to any who should free them from the imposition of the monster ; and it is said that Oedipus volunteered to sacrifice himself for their deliverance . Accordingly , he approached the sphinx , and was asked— “ What being has 4 feet , 2 feet , and 3 feet , at different times of its life , and is weakest when it has most ? ” On being given the answer that it is—Man , the ogre hurled itself to death from the precipice on which it was perched , and thus the Thebans were freed from its spell .
[Beurla]

Chaidh Fionn do ’ n bheinn ,
’ S cha deach ’ “ Idir ” ;
Dh ’ fhas a bhean tinn ,
’ S cha d ’ fhas “ Idir . ”
— “ IDIR ” —A CHU .

Chi mi thallud air a ’ bheinn
Fear ciar - ghlas ’ us beum fo shroin ,
Da fhiacail fhada an a cheann ,
’ Us plaide de lion mu a thoin .
—GEARR .
No—

Latha dhomh ’ s mi a ’ siubhal bheann
Chunnaic mi na b ’ ionghnadh leam ,
Fichead suil ’ s an aon cheann ,
Deich teangannan a ’ bruidheann rium .
—NEAD EUN AN CLABAN - CINN BEATHAICH MHAIRBH .
[Beurla]

Is buige e na am brochan ,
Is cruaidhe e na an t - aran ,
Bithidh e an comhnuidh an cuideachd an righ ;
’ Us chan ’ eil iad air thalamh
Nach feum bhith ’ ga ghabhail ,
Is cha tig iad ro - mhath as a dhith .
—UISGE .

Tha e ag eirigh a h - uile maduinn ,
’ Us cha deachaidh e riamh a laighe .
—FUARAN - FUCHAIDH .

Tha mi na ’ s airde na beanntan an domhain ,
Agus gun bhreug tha mo leud gun thomhas ,
Cumaidh an sealgair mi suas an cluais a ghunna ,
Ged tha mi na ’ s truime na mile tunna .
—AN T - AILE .

Theid mi null air mo dhrochaid ghlainne ,
Thig mi nall air mo dhrochaid ghlainne ,
’ Us ma bhriseas mo drochaid ghlainne
Chan ’ eil an Albainn no an Eirinn
A chaireas , mo dhrochaid ghlainne .
—AN EIGH .

Fear dubh , namhaid clisbiche ( Fuar dubh namhaid clisgeadach )
Bheir e ort ruith air uisgeachan .
—REODHADH .
[Beurla]

Thainig eun gun iteag
’ Us laigh e air lag tobhtaig ’ ,
Thainig eun gun bheul
’ Us dh ’ ith e eun gun iteag .
—SNEACHD AGUS UISGE .

Tha mile dearceag air an t - sliabh
Nach itheadh neach a rugadh riamh ;
Fasaidh iad ri oidhche bhriagh
Ach siubhlaidh iad ’ nuair dhealras grian .
—DEALT .

Chi mi , chi mi fada bhuam ,
Leth - cheud sineadh thar a ’ chuain ,
Luchd gun fhuil , gun fheoil , gun anam ,
A ’ leumadraich air talamh cruaidh .
—CLACHAN - MEALLAIN .

Tha gamhainn maol donn ’ s a ’ choill ’ ud thall ,
’ Us chan ’ eil maide ann nach cuir e air chrith .
—GAOTH .

Cia mar a tha macstalla coltach ri boirionnach ?
—BITHIDH AM FACAL MU DHEIREADH AIGE GE B ’ OIL LEAT .

Tha long a ’ seoladh cuain fo thamh
Le a claran ban ’ ’ us ard shiuil dhubh ’ ;
Ach mun till i rinn a rithis do ’ gnaths ,
Bi ’ a cruinn ’ s a h - ard - shiuil bàn mar ghruth .
—GEALACH UR .
[Beurla]

Long mhor nam ban - sheol boidheach ,
Nach faic thu a ’ seoladh ach an aghaidh gaoithe .
—A ’ GHEALACH .

Mias mhor fheodair ’ us ceud toll òir innt ’ .
—AN T - ADHAR .

Theid e do ’ n teine ’ s cha loisgear e ,
Theid e do ’ n chiste , ’ s cha mhurtar e ,
Theid e do ’ n mhuir , ’ s cha bhathar e ,
Theid e gu bord an righ ’ s cha bhacar e .
—GATH - GREINE .
No—

Co na casan a ’ s faide a tha air an t - saoghal ?
—CASAN CAIRBINN FO ’ N GHREIN .

Tha companach leat tric a saothair ,
Ach chan ’ eil math no cron ’ n a shaothair ;
’ Us ged ni thu a ’ chuis cho math as aonais ,
Cha ghabh e a chur bhuat air saodach .
—D ’ FHAILEAS .

Co na fir a ’ s aigeannaiche a tha air an t - saoghal ?
—NA FIR - CHLIS .
[Beurla]

Co an druim a ’ s laidire a tha air an t - saoghal ?
—DRUIM A ’ CHUAIN .

Co a ’ chailleach a ’ s cumhachdaiche a tha air an t - saoghal ?
—A ’ CHAILLEACH BHEURR ( An Geamhradh , no Crith - thalmhainn ) .

A ’ mhuc a thainig a Eirinn ,
’ S ann oirre fein a bha an eiginn shearbh :
Tri tonna , tri tanna ,
Muc air fhichead ’ us fichead mheanbh .
—NA TRI STUADHAN MORA AN CLIATH - THONN RI STOIRM . *
No—

Ri am stoirme , ’ s ri am fiatha ,
Ri am lionaidh , ’ s ri am traghaidh ,
’ Us ris gach am bho cheann na bliadhna ,
Cha dhean striochdadh duinn a ghaire .
—EAS .
No—
[Beurla]
No—
No—

Togaidh leanabh beag ’ n a dhorn e ,
’ Us cha thog da dhuine dheug le rop e .
—UGH .
No—

Togtar suas e cho geal ris an t - sneachda ,
Ach leagtar a nuas e òr - bhuidhe air leaca .
—UGH BRISTE ,
No—

Sruth an aghaidh airde .
—BEATHACH AG OL DIGHE .
[Beurla]

Chunnaic mi ionghnadh an de ,
Ma ’ s ionghnadh leam , is ionghnadh e ,
Fear mor a ’ tighinn bho an cheo ,
Agus e beo , gun anail ’ n a chreubh .
—LASAIR THEINE .

Tha suilean ann ’ s chan fhaic e ni ,
Tha e feumail a chum bidh ’
Tha rusg ’ g a chomhdachadh ’ s gach ball
Cha chaora ’ us cha chraobh a th ’ ann .
—BUNTATA .

Barr biorach air , ’ s cha mhinidh e ,
Roinn gheur air , ’ s cha sgeilb e ,
Feusag air , ’ s cha ghobhar e ,
Ton odhar air , ’ s chan earb e .
—LUACHAIR .

Tha moigean mollach , mollach ,
A ’ sior - thuineachadh a ’ mhonaidh ;
Is gil ’ e na gobhair an aonaich ,
Is gile na caoraich am moigean mollach .
—CANACH .

Is luaithid e a chas a briseadh .
—GAS RAINICH .
( Mar a thubhairt am fear a chunnaic gas rainich a ’ falbh leis a ’ ghaoith ) .

Co a ’ bhrog nach deachaidh riamh mu chois duine ?
—BROG - NA - CUTHAIGE .
[Beurla]

Moigean min , min , mollach ,
A thig air tir air na torran ;
Chan ith crodh no caoraich e ,
Ach ithidh daoine am moigean mollach .
—DUILEASG .

Bean bheag mhoganach ,
Suidhidh i taganach ,
Bithidh i torrach a h - uile bliadhna ,
’ Us bithidh laogh beag geal aice .
—CNO .

Ciod iad do phriomh luchd - cuideachaidh ? —
Coignear ’ s gach taic ,
Coignear ’ s gach glaic ,
’ Us coignear nach faic thu an tairbheartan .
—COIG MEOIREAN DO CHOISE AGUS DO LAIMHE AGUS D ’ FHAIREACHDAINEAN .

Lan taighe chaorach geala ,
’ Us aon chaora dhearg ann ;
Agus an te dhearg air dearg deargan a ’ chuthaich .
—BEUL , DEUD , AGUS TEANGA .

Cha mhotha e na grainean eorna ,
’ Us comhdaichidh e bord an righ .
—AMHARCAN .

Co e an deagh charaid dileas
A ’ s trice a ghiulanas gu diblidh d ’ eallach ?
—DO DHRUIM FEIN .
[Beurla]

Ciamar a tha fiacail a chaidh a tarraing coltach ri ni a chaidh air di - chuimhne ?
—DH ’ FHALBH I AS A ’ CHEANN .

Rud nach ’ eil , nach robh , ’ s nach bi ,
Sin do lamh , ’ us chi thu e .
—NACH ’ EIL NA MEOIREAN CO - IONNAN AM FAD .

Rud a tha , ’ s a bha , ’ s a bhitheas ,
Sin do lamh , ’ us chi thu e .
—NA THA AIG A ’ MHEUR MHEADHOIN AIR CACH .

Craobh ghioganach , ghàganach ,
A bun gu h - ard , ’ s a barr gu h - iseal .
—EARBALL BEATHAICH .

Cuman ur , adhar , a thug m ’ athair a Ros ,
Ged rachadh e air a bheul fodha ,
Cha tigeadh boinne as .
—UTH BA .

Ceithir ’ nan ruith ,
Ceithir air chrith ,
Dithis ag coimhead ’ san adhar ,
Dithis a ’ deanamh an rathaid ,
Agus aon ag eigheach .
—MART ’ NA RUITH , — CASAN , SINEAN , ADHAIRCEAN , SUILEAN , BEUL .

Co e an currachd nach d ’ rinneadh riamh le lamhan dhaoine ?
—CURRACHD - AN - RIGH .
[Beurla]

Tri casan oirre , ’ s cha choisich i ,
Da chluais oirre , ’ s cha chluinn i ,
Beul mor aice , ’ s cha bhruidhinn i ,
’ Us mas mor cruinn oirr ’ .
—POIT THRI - CHASACH .
No—
No—

Caora dhubh , dhubh , a thilgeas ceud lomara geal anns a ’ bhliadhna .
—GREIDEAL .
No—

Bean an taighe ag gliogan ,
Bean an taighe ag glagan ,
Bean an taighe a dh ’ ith am biadh ,
’ S d ’ rinn riamh altachadh .
—CUIBHEAL - SHNIOMHA .
[Beurla]

Bean uaine bhoidheach
Air cul na comhla ,
Gun bhoineid , gun bhotunn ,
Ach ropan mu a com .
—SGUABACH - FHRAOICH .

Tha mi air bord gach maith ’ s gach mith ,
’ Us tha mi an comhnuidh lan ,
Gidheadh cha deachaidh riamh am chorp
Na thogadh tu air spain .
—SPAIN .

Chaidh mi a mach eadar da choille , agus thill mi dachaigh eadar da alltan .
—TARRAING UISGE LE CUINNEAGAN .

Bean thorrach anns a ’ bhaile ud thall ,
Ge torrach i cha bheir i clann ;
Olar am fion bharr a boise ,
’ Us caol a coise troimh a ceann .
—GLAINNE LAN .
No—

Bodach beag an taobh an teine ,
Bior ’ na ghoile , ’ us boinneid air .
—CLOBHA .
[Beurla]

Anna beag a ’ chota bhain ,
Mar is motha a ghabhas i , *
’ S mar is faide a sheasas i ,
Is ann is lugha a bhitheas i a ’ fas .
—COINNEAL .

Rud mor cruinn , dubh ,
A bhitheas a mireadh ris an t - sruth ;
Chan ’ eil an Albainn , no an Eirinn ,
A leumas air a mhuin .
—ROTH - MUILNE .

Each dubh , ’ us each donn ,
Bonn ri bonn ;
Ged is luath an t - each dubh ,
Is seachd luaithe an t - each donn .
—AN ROTH AGUS AN T - UISGE
No—

Is e croileagan , beag croileagan
( Tomhais , tomhais , toimhseachan )
A rinn mi fein ’ s mo Dhomhnullan ;
Thoilleadh ceud nan ceudan ann ,
’ S cha thoill mi fein am aonar ann .
—BRA .
No—
* A play on the word—Gabh—which means—to take , as well as—to kindle .
[Beurla]

Bithidh e a muigh ,
Bithidh e a staigh ,
Bithidh e an taigh an lodain ;
Ceann corrach air a bhas ,
Buailidh e gnocag .
—LOINID .

Chunnacas ionghnadh leam an diugh ,
’ S ma ’ s ionghnadh leam is ionghnadh dhut : —
Ceithir daimh * gun fhuil , gun fheoil ,
A ’ spionadh feoir a talamh dubh .
—CLIATH - CHLIATHTA .

Siubhlaidh e na lianagan ,
Siubhlaidh e na brianagan ,
Siubhlaidh e an t - iomaire fada ,
’ Us thig e dachaigh anmoch .
—CORRAN .

“ Theid mi do ’ n choill ’ , ” arsa a chrom fhada chruinn ,
“ ’ Us chan ’ eil anns a ’ choill ’ , ” arsa a chrom fhada chruinn ,
“ Nach leag mi air an druim , ” arsa a chrom fhada chruinn .
—TUAGH .

Maide fada fiar ,
A ’ tighinn air tir air talamh cian :
Maide biorach , tollach , tairgneach ;
Maide balg - fhionn , fada , crom .
—ISNEACH .
[Beurla]

Tha teanga fhada , chaol , chruaidh ,
Aig mo luaidh an ribhinn og ;
Is lionmhor iad le am miann a guth ,
Is ioma neach le am miann a pog .
—TRUMB .
No—

Caora bhiorach , bhiorach , ’ s a mionach slaodte rithe .
—SNATHAD AGUS SNATHNAIN .

Tuba gun mhas , ’ s i lan feola .
—MEURAN TAILLEIR .
No—
No—

Damh donn a ’ dol troimh ’ n choille ,
’ Us chan ’ eil slat anns a ’ choille ,
Nach bean ri a dhruim .
—SPAL - FIGHEADAIR .

Maide mor crom anns a ’ choill ’ ud thall ,
’ S gun ni ann ach glang , bo glang .
—GREALLAG BEAIRT - FHIGHE .
[Beurla]

Tha bodach beag ’ s a ’ chuil sin
’ Us da shuil dheug ann .
—CRIATHAR .
No—

Theid mi null air mo rathad mor ,
Thig mi nall air mo rathad mor ,
’ Us bheir mi leam mo rathad mor air mo mhuin .
—FARADH .

Iarunn a cheann , each a mhuineal , maide a mheadhon , duine a bhun .
—DUBHAN , SNOD , SLAT , IASGAIR .

Eunan beag foirmeil , foirmeil ,
Bithidh e a mach ri side stoirmeil ;
’ Us ged nach do chuir e riamh a chul ann ,
Chan ’ eil feum ri aimsir chiuin ann .
—COILEACH - GAOITHE .

Rud mor fada , dubh ,
Bithidh e a muigh air feadh na h - oidhche ;
Bithidh a mhionach ag eigheach ,
’ S gun e fein ag canail guth .
—TAIGH LAN DHAOINE .
[Beurla]

Chan ’ eil e a muigh ,
Chan ’ eil e a staigh ,
’ S cha tig an taigh as aonais .
—DORUS , NO UINNEAG .

Muc dhubh dhorcha ,
An ceann taigh Fhearachair ,
Dithis ’ n a ceann ,
’ Us triuir ’ n a h - earball .
—CLACH - STEIDHE .

Is airde e na taigh an righ ,
Is mine e na sioda ,
Is geire e na ’ n claidheamh .
—DEATHACH .
No—

Cionnus a thiodhlaiceas am marbh am beo ?
—SMALADH AN TEINE .

Da rud bheaga dhubha co - ionnan ri a cheile ;
Tha aon diubh uile cearr * ’ us aon diubh uile ceart ;
Ach nan robh an t - aon tha uile ceart
Air a dheanamh uile cearr ,
Bhitheadh an t - aon tha uile cearr ,
Air a dheanamh uile ceart .
—PAIDHIR BHROG , NO MHAITEAGAN .
[Beurla]

Dubhag dubhag a mach an dorus
’ Us cnaimh duine aice ’ n a beul .
—BROG .

Poit bheag neonach
A ’ seoladh troimh an tir ;
I lomalan feola ,
’ S a ton os a cionn .
—AD .

Tobaran oir am meadhon a ’ bhaile seo ,
Tri cinn oir , agus comhla ghlainne ris .
—UAIREADAIR AIR SPIRIS .

Bodach beag an taigh mo sheanar ,
Chan fhaicear gean no greann air ,
Chan ith e biadh , chan ol e fion ,
’ Us bha e riamh a ’ dannsadh .
—UAIREADAIR .

Da fhear dheug ’ s an aon leabaidh
Agus gach aon air an iomall .
—CLAIR BALLAIN .

Siubhlaidh e mar ghaoith air luathas ,
Gun ghluasad as an aon aite ;
Ach tuitidh e ma stadas e ,
’ S cha sheas e air a shail dhut .
—GILLEMIREAN .
[Beurla]

Lubaidh na mairbh air gach taobh dhiubh le umhlachd ,
Ach leumaidh na beothaibh a null air an ceann .
—CLACHAN STAIRE .

Sheall mi a mach air uinneig mo sheanamhar ,
’ Us chunnaic mi am marbh ag giulan nam beo .
—BATA AGUS SGIOBA .

Cha shiubhail e ’ s an adhar ,
Cha shiubhail e air lar ;
Ach siubhlaidh e sar ,
Eadar lar agus adhar .
—BATA .
No—

* Is gile i na canach an t - sleibhe ,
Is gile i na leine , no anart ;
Is meanbh - bhruc i na uchd na druide ,
Agus olaidh i mar gheibh i .
—LITIR .
No—
[Beurla]
No—
No—

Tobar a ’ siubhal air comhnard reidh ,
Agus a shruthan ’ n a dheidh car dubhach .
—PEANN .

Thainig e a feoil ,
’ Us chan e feoil a tha ann ;
Innsidh e naidheachd ,
Gun teanga ’ n a cheann .
—PEANN ITE .

Rud dubh , dubh ,
A tha chum feuma an ioma cruth ;
Cha dean e feum mur labhair e ,
’ Us an deidh labhairt chan fhiach e .
—FUDAR .

Theid e null air an abhainn ,
Thig e nall air an abhainn ;
Gearraidh e am feur ,
Agus chan ith e e .
—PEILEAR GUNNA .
[Beurla]

Siud e , agus co a chi e ?
—SRADAG

Tioram , cha ghabh ; fliuch , gabhaidh .
—LUAITHRE AGUS OLA .

Teadhair fhada chaol bhan ,
’ Us i ’ n a tamh daonnan .
—AN RATHAD MOR .

Theid na mairbh seachad fodha ,
Le othail ’ s le solas ;
’ Us na beothaibh air uachdar ,
Le suairceas ’ s le eolas .
—DROCHAID .

Cha mhac athar , no mathar domh e ,
Cha mhac peathar , no brathar domh e ,
Ach b ’ e mo mhathair bu mhathair do mhathair a ’ ghille .
—A MAC FEIN .

Tha brathair aig brathair m ’ athar ,
’ S cha bhrathair athar domhsa e .
—A ATHAIR FEIN .

Chraobh cham chaorainn
An taobh taigh an tuathanaich ;
Ged thigeadh luchd an t - saoghail ,
Chan fhaodadh iad a buain as .
—A BHEAN .
[Beurla]

Rugadh e gun anam ,
Bhasaich e gun anam ,
Agus bha anam ann .
—AN UILEBHEIST A SHLUIG IONA .

Rugadh e mu an d ’ rugadh athair ,
Agus chaochail e mu an d ’ rugadh a mhathair .
—CAIN NO ABAIL .

Chi sinne bitheanta e ,
Chan fhaic an righ ach ainmig e ,
Agus chan fhaca Dia riamh e .
—NEACH A ’ S AIRDE NA E FEIN .

Bu e am fiodh an iuchair ,
An t - uisge a ’ ghlas ,
Chailleadh na sealgairean ,
Agus fhuair an t - sealg as .
—SLAT - DHRUIDHEACHD MHAOIS : A ’ MHUIR RUADH : NA H - EIPHITICH : AGUS CLANN IOSRAIL .

Co am beathach a ghiulan an t - eallach a bu luachmhoire a bha riamh air thalamh .
—AN T - ASAL A GHIULAN MUIRE AGUS IOSA DO AN EIPHIT .

Is mairg aig am bi iad ,
Is mairg aig nach bi iad ; co iad ?
—CLANN .
[Beurla]

Co an t - each agus an lair nach facas riamh a ’ treabhadh ?
—EACH - UISGE AGUS LAIR - MHAIDE . †

Ciamar a tha leabaidh an t - slaodaire ro ghoirid da ?
—THA E RO FHADA INNTE .

Cionnus a tha coltas nàrach air an uaireadair ?
—THA A DHA LAIMH DAONNAN AIR A AODANN .

Ciod a tha na ’ s cruinne na ball , agus na ’ s faide na long ?
—CEIRTLE SHNATHA .

Co an crann nach dean treabhadh ged chuireadh tu daoine ’ ga stiuireadh , agus eich ’ ga tharraing ?
—CRANN - SGADAIN . ‡

Ciod iad tri coilceadha na Feinne ?
—BARR GHEAL - CHRANN , COINEACH , ’ US UR - LUCHAIR .

Ciod iad na tri buillean a ’ s duiliche am fulang ?
—BUILLE ’ S AN T - SUIL , BUILLE ’ S A ’ GHLUIN , AGUS BUILLE ’ S AN UILLINN .

Ciod iad tri subhailcean a ’ bhaird ?
—CIOCRAS COIN GU LAN A BHRONN , FIOS FITHICH A ’ RUITH GU ROIC , TART FRITH - FHIR GU OL A DHRAM .

† Literally— “ wooden mare . ”
‡ Pun on word “ crann , ” which is equivalent to “ plough , ” and also to “ four baskets of fish . ”
[Beurla]

Ciod iad na tri gneithean a ’ s dorra an stiuireadh ?
—GNE CIRCE , GNE MUICE , AGUS GNE MNATHA : —GABHAIDH IAD AN RATHAD FEIN .

Ciod iad na tri beathaichean a ’ s luaithe air sliabh ?
—MIOL - CHU , FIADH , AGUS GEARR .

Ciod iad na tri a ’ s luaithe ’ s an speur ?
—GOBHLAN - GAOITHE , IOLAIR , AGUS SEABHAG - GHORM .

Ciod iad na tri nithean a ’ s duiliche greim a dheanamh orra ?
—EARR A ’ BHRADAIN , A ’ CHAS - DEIRIDH AIG FIADH , AGUS SGIATH NA MUICE - MARA .

Ciod iad na tri buill cuirp a ’ s fuaire ?
—ADHARC DAIMH , SRON COIN , AGUS GLUN FIR .
[Beurla]

Ciod iad na tri ainmhidhean nach fuiling an cniadachadh ?
—CAORA , CEARC , AGUS CAILLEACH .

Ciod iad na tri nithean a thig gun iarraidh ?
—EAGAL , IADACH AGUS GAOL .

Ciod iad na tri nithean de nach do ghabh an Gaidheal riamh naire ?
—BREAC A LINNE , FIADH A FIRICH , AGUS SLAT A COILLE .

Ciod iad na tri comharraidhean air laraich mhallaichte ?
—DEANNTAG , DROMAN , AGUS TRIAN - RI - TRIAN .

Ciod iad na tri uilc a thig le aois ?
—BAOTHACHD , BOILE , AGUS BAS .

Ciod iad an triuir mharbh a ’ s boidhche a tha ann ? —
BREAC GEAL , COILEACH DUBH , AGUS LEANABH BEAG .

Ciod iad na tri aitean a ’ s fearr air son naidheachd ?
—TAIGH - OSDA , MUILEANN , AGUS CEARDACH .

Ciod iad tri mallachdan an tuathanaich ?
—REODHADH CEITEIN , CEO IUCHAR , AGUS AN TAOITEAR SAILEACH . *
[Beurla]

Ciod iad na tri Gaothan a ’ s fuaire a tha ann ?
—GAOTH AN DEIDH AITEIMH , GAOTH TROIMH THOLL , AGUS GAOTH BHO BHONN SIUIL .

Ciod na tri nithean a ’ s milse a tha ann ?
—MO CHUID FEIN , MO BHEAN FEIN , AGUS TIUGAINN DACHAIGH .

Ciod iad ceithir aoisean an duine ?
—FICHEAD BLIADHNA A ’ TEACHD , FICHEAD BLIADHNA CHUM MATH , FICHEAD BLIADHNA A ’ MEATH , FICHEAD BLIADHNA GUN RATH .

Ciod iad na ceithir comharraidhean air ceill ?
—FOIDHIDINN , FOSDACHD , STUAMACHD , AGUS UR - LABRADH .

Ciod iad na sia buadhan a bha ag cumail suas na Feinne ?
—AGH FHINN , LAMH GHOILL , PRAB - BHUILLEAN OSCAIR , IOMAIRT EALAMH OISEIN , RUITH CHRUAIDH CHAOILTE , AGUS SUIDHEACHADH CHOMAIL AIR A CHATH .
[Beurla]

Ciod e cho fada agus a ghiulanas ainmhidhean an al ?
—TRI MIOSAN CU , COIG BHO CHAOGAD CAT , IS IONNAN BEAN ’ US BO , BLIADHNA MHOR DO ’ N EACH .

Ciod e an tinneas a ’ s fearr na an t - slainte ?
—BREITH .

Ciod is lionmhoire na feur ?
—DRIUCHD .

Ciod is teotha na an teine ?
—GNUIS DUINE MHATH AIR AN TIG AOIGHEAN , AGUS E GUN BHIADH , GUN DEOCH .

Ciod is luaithe na a ’ ghaoth ?
—MEANMA MNATHA .
[Beurla]

Ciod is milse na a ’ mhil ?
—BRIATHRAN TOCHMHAIRCE .

Ciod is duibhe na am fitheach ?
—EUG .

Ciod is seirbhe na an neimh ?
—AITHIS NAMHAID .

Ciod is geire na an claidheamh ?
—CIALL MNATHA EADAR DA FHEAR .

Ciod is fearr na seudan ?
—SGIAN .

Ciod is maoithe na cloimh ?
—DEARNA RI LEACAINN .

Ciod is gile na sneachd ?
—FIRINN .

Ciod is long ri gach luchd ?
—TEANCHAIR GOBHANN .

Ciod is fearr do laoch ?
—GNIOMH ARD , AGUS UAILL ISEAL .
[Beurla]

Ciod is brisge na currabhallan ?
—AIGNE MNATHA EADAR DA FHEAR .

Ciod is fearr do mhnaoi ?
—TLAS , FOS FEILE .

Ciod is fearr do rosg mnatha ?
—FUACHD , DORCHADAS , CADAL .

Ciod is fearr de bhiadh ?
—BLIOCHD .

Ciod is miosa de bhiadh ?
—BLIANACH , AGUS OL CORMA * AIR A ’ CHEUD LONGADH .

Cia lion crann a ta anns a ’ choille ?
—A DHA , EADHON , UR AGUS SEAN .

Arsa cailleach . —
Nam bitheadh agam na bheil agam ,
Uiread eile , ’ s a leth uiread ,
Da gheadh , agus blaigh geoidh ,
Dheanadh sin fichead . Cia meud a bha aice ?
—COIG .

* Posidonius , the Stoic , a traveller of the 1st century , whose works have been lost , is quoted by Atheneus , who lived in the 3rd century , as saying of the Celts : — “ The poor make beer from wheat and mix it with honey . —They called it ‘ Korma . ’ ”
[Beurla]

Da fhitheach air creig ,
Da fhitheach gob ri gob ,
Fitheach ag eigheach air fitheach ,
Cia meud fitheach a bha an sin ?
—DA FHITHEACH .

Chunnaic duine gun suilean ,
Craobh air an robh ubhlan ,
Cha d ’ thug e ubhlan dith ,
’ S cha d ’ fhag e ubhlan oirre .
Ciamar a bha sin ?
—FEAR CAM , DA UBHAL , AGUS THUG E LEIS AON .

Is math a dhannsadh Uisdean Friseal ,
Uisdean Friseal , Uisdean Friseal ,
Is math a dhannsadh Uisdean Friseal ,
Leis an fhichead maighdinn ;
Coignear roimhe , ’ s an a dheidh ,
Coignear roimhe , ’ s an a dheidh ,
Coignear roimhe , ’ s an a dheidh ,
Coignear air gach laimh deth .
—Cia meud maighdean a bha a ’ dannsadh leis ?
—BHA E A ’ DANNSADH LEIS FEIN ; LE COIG MEOIREAN AIR GACH COIS , AGUS LAIMH .

AISEAG AN T - SIONNAICH , NA GOIBHRE , AGUS AN FHEOIR .
Cha b ’ urrainn am fear - aiseig a thoirt leis ach aon air gach turus ; agus nam fagteadh iad leotha fein , dh ’ itheadh an sionnach a ’ ghobhar , agus dh ’ itheadh a ’ ghobhar am feur . Cia mar a chaidh aige air an giulan ? —
[Beurla]
[Beurla]

Bha sianar a ’ sireadh aiseig thar caolais , —triuir fhear agus am mnathan . Cha robh ri fhaotainn ach coit bheag nach tugadh leithe ach dithis aig an aon am . Bha na fir ag iadach , air chor agus nach faodadh aon diubh a bhith air fhagail ach le a bhean fein .
Cia mar a fhuair iad a null ? —

Bha soitheach nan ochd lan , agus lion e soitheach nan tri .
Thaom e na tri gallain seo an soitheach nan coig , agus lion e rithis soitheach nan tri .
An sin , chuir e an soitheach nan coig na ghabhadh e a soitheach nan tri , agus bha an roinn a nis mar seo , — aon , anns an fhear bheag ; coig , anns an fhear mheadhonach , agus a dha , anns an fhear mhor .
Dh ’ fhalamhaich e am fear meadhonach anns an fhear mhor , agus chuir e na bha anns an fhear bheag anns an fear mheadhonach .
Lion e an sin am fear beag as an fhear mhor , agus dhoirt e na bha anns an fhear bheag anns an fhear mheadhonach . Bha mar sin ceithir gallain anns an fhear mheadhonach , agus a ’ cheart uiread anns an fhear mhor .
[Beurla]

Chan ith thu e ,
Chan ol thu e ,
’ S cha bhi thu beo as aonais .
—CADAL .

Is airde e na beanntan ,
Is doimhne e na muir ,
Is geire a na droigheann dhubh ,
Is milse e na mil .
—GAOL .
No—

Chi mi chugam thar an neas ’
Fear beag , cuirneanach , cas ,
Cearb de aodach fo a shlios ,
’ Us lan an t - saoghail fo a los .
—BAS .

Is cumhang an teach seo
Do an neach ni ann tamh .
E gun uinneag , gun dorus ,
’ G a fhosgladh gu brath .
—CISTE - LAIGHE .

* An analogous riddle is associated with Homer . It is— “ Two boys went to hunt in a secluded place . What they caught they threw away , and what they did not catch they took home . ” Tradition has it that Homer failed to answer it , though it would be obvious to any dirty tinker boy .
[Beurla]

Cia mar a dh ’ aithnichear adag seach cuiteag ?
—Ball dubh air an adaig , ’ us earball fada air a ’ chuiteig .

Ciod iad na roinn a ’ s fearr de eisg
—Cliabh sgadain , tarr bradain , ’ us cul cinn a ’ bhric dhuibh .
[Beurla]

Cia mar a thaghadh tu each ?
Mar shionnach : —domhain anns an aisne , direach anns an druim , cracach anns an earball :
Mar ghearr : —fada anns a ’ chois , ullamh gu gniomh , agus biorach anns a ’ chluais :
Mar mhnaoi : —Cruinn anns a ’ mhas , lan anns an uchd , agus bog anns a ’ bheul .
[Beurla]
No—
No—

Chaidh neach le each gu a chruibheadh , agus mar seo thubhairt ris a ’ ghobhainn : —
“ Tabhair de an each na cruibhean a tha air ,
Cruibh e leis na cruibhean a tha air ,
Ach na cuir air na cruibhean a tha air . ”
Ciamar a rinn an gobha ? Thug e na seann cruibhean de an each , rinn e ord diubh , agus leis an ord ur chuir e cruibhean ura air an each .
[Beurla]

Dh ’ fhaighnich gille de nighinn , agus i aig uinneig fhosgailte , c ’ uine a rachadh i leis air chuairt ; agus fhuair e an fhreagairt a leanas : —
“ An uair a thogas mi an lion ,
A leagas mi a ’ ghlainne ,
Agus a chuireas mi am marbh a thiodhlaiceadh a ’ bheo . ”
Thug e - san an sin suas a dhochas , sheol e thairis , agus air dha tilleadh an ceann tri bliadhna , chuala e gu robh i posda aig fear eile , ach nach robh i idir toilichte : chuir seo smuairean air , agus chaidh e a choimhead oirre , agus fhuair e fuasgladh air na facail mar seo : —
“ Cho luath agus a thogainn an t - anart de ’ n bhord ,
A dhuininn an uinneag ,
Agus a smalainn an teine : agus cha do chum sin fada mise , ged bha thusa mi - fhoidhidneach . ”

Cha do dhirich Fionn bruthach riamh , agus cha d ’ fhag e bruthach gun a direadh . —
Ghabh e gach bruthach air a tarsuinn .

* Cf . —
Cladh Cill Da - Bhi
Thiodhlaic mi mo naoinear ann mar thri
An nochd is dubhach Doirbhean
An deidh na cloinne caoimhe .
—Vide C . P . N . S . , p . 308 .
[Beurla]

Da chois shios
Tri casan shuas
’ Us ceann a ’ bheo am beul a ’ mhairbh .
—NEACH AGUS POIT THRI - CHASACH AIR A CHEANN . *

Bha neach a ’ dol air turus . Ruith a choimhearsnach ’ n a dheidh agus dh ’ innis e dha mu thubaist a thachair . Fhreagair am fear eile ’ n a chabhaig mar seo : —
“ Bath ’ n ath , ma ’ s e m ’ ath - s ’ i ,
Bhathainn - s ’ i , nam b ’ e d ’ ath - s ’ i . ”
[Beurla]
[Beurla]
* This is a pun on the word— “ mol . ”
[Beurla]
[Beurla]
[Beurla]
